OriginalSource.Comment: Image resized and made smaller per OCC
Image approved by Pediatric Treatment Editorial Board
Image added as summary placeholder; Board approval pending

PermissionInformation.Comment: Permissions not required; photo came from Pediatric Treatment Editorial Board member, Denise Adams, MD

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Photograph showing a large segmental hemangioma (plaque-like) in a bearded distribution on the right side of the face.

Captions.MediaCaption: A large segmental hemangioma (plaque-like) in a bearded distribution. This patient has an increased risk of PHACE syndrome, airway hemangioma, and ulceration. A tracheostomy was placed secondary to a very diffuse airway hemangioma. Credit: Denise Adams, M.D.
